5#ifndef V8_OBJECTS_BYTECODE_ARRAY_H_
6#define V8_OBJECTS_BYTECODE_ARRAY_H_
7
8#include "src/objects/struct.h"
9#include "src/objects/trusted-object.h"
10
11// Has to be the last include (doesn't have include guards):
12#include "src/objects/object-macros.h"
13
14namespace v8 {
15namespace internal {
16
17class BytecodeWrapper;
18
19namespace interpreter {
20class Register;
21} // namespace interpreter
22
23// TODO(jgruber): These should no longer be included here; instead, all
24// TorqueGeneratedFooAsserts should be emitted into a global .cc file.
25#include "torque-generated/src/objects/bytecode-array-tq.inc"
26
27// BytecodeArray represents a sequence of interpreter bytecodes.
28class BytecodeArray : public ExposedTrustedObject {
29 public:
30 // The length of this bytecode array, in bytes.
31 inline int length() const;
32 inline int length(AcquireLoadTag tag) const;
33 inline void set_length(int value);
34 inline void set_length(int value, ReleaseStoreTag tag);
35
36 // The handler table contains offsets of exception handlers.
37 DECL_PROTECTED_POINTER_ACCESSORS(handler_table, TrustedByteArray)
38
39 DECL_PROTECTED_POINTER_ACCESSORS(constant_pool, TrustedFixedArray)
40
41 // The BytecodeWrapper for this BytecodeArray. When the sandbox is enabled,
42 // the BytecodeArray lives in trusted space outside of the sandbox, but the
43 // wrapper object lives inside the main heap and therefore inside the
44 // sandbox. As such, the wrapper object can be used in cases where a
45 // BytecodeArray needs to be referenced alongside other tagged pointer
46 // references (so for example inside a FixedArray).
47 DECL_ACCESSORS(wrapper, Tagged<BytecodeWrapper>)
48
49 // Source position table. Can contain:
50 // * Smi::zero() (initial value, or if an error occurred while explicitly
51 // collecting source positions for pre-existing bytecode).
52 // * empty_trusted_byte_array (for bytecode generated for functions that will
53 // never have source positions, e.g. native functions).
54 // * TrustedByteArray (if source positions were collected for the bytecode)
55 DECL_RELEASE_ACQUIRE_PROTECTED_POINTER_ACCESSORS(source_position_table,
56 TrustedByteArray)
57
58 DECL_INT32_ACCESSORS(frame_size)
59
60 static constexpr int SizeFor(int length) {
61 return OBJECT_POINTER_ALIGN(kHeaderSize + length);
62 }
63
64 inline uint8_t get(int index) const;
65 inline void set(int index, uint8_t value);
66
67 inline Address GetFirstBytecodeAddress();
68
69 // Note: The register count is derived from frame_size.
70 inline int register_count() const;
71
72 // Note: the parameter count includes the implicit 'this' receiver.
73 inline int32_t parameter_count() const;
74 inline void set_parameter_count(int32_t number_of_parameters);
75
76 inline interpreter::Register incoming_new_target_or_generator_register()
77 const;
78 inline void set_incoming_new_target_or_generator_register(
79 interpreter::Register incoming_new_target_or_generator_register);
80
81 inline bool HasSourcePositionTable() const;
82
83 // If source positions have not been collected or an exception has been thrown
84 // this will return the empty_trusted_byte_array.
85 DECL_GETTER(SourcePositionTable, Tagged<TrustedByteArray>)
86
87 // Raw accessors to access these fields during code cache deserialization.
88 DECL_GETTER(raw_constant_pool, Tagged<Object>)
89 DECL_GETTER(raw_handler_table, Tagged<Object>)
90 // This accessor can also be used when it's not guaranteed that a source
91 // position table exists, for example because it hasn't been collected. In
92 // that case, Smi::zero() will be returned.
93 DECL_ACQUIRE_GETTER(raw_source_position_table, Tagged<Object>)
94
95 // Indicates that an attempt was made to collect source positions, but that it
96 // failed, most likely due to stack exhaustion. When in this state
97 // |SourcePositionTable| will return an empty byte array.
98 inline void SetSourcePositionsFailedToCollect();
99
100 inline int BytecodeArraySize() const;
101
102 // Returns the size of bytecode and its metadata. This includes the size of
103 // bytecode, constant pool, source position table, and handler table.
104 DECL_GETTER(SizeIncludingMetadata, int)
105
106 DECL_CAST(BytecodeArray)
107 DECL_PRINTER(BytecodeArray)
108 DECL_VERIFIER(BytecodeArray)
109
110 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void PrintJson(std::ostream& os);
111 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void Disassemble(std::ostream& os);
112
113 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static void Disassemble(Handle<BytecodeArray> handle,
114 std::ostream& os);
115
116 void CopyBytecodesTo(Tagged<BytecodeArray> to);
117
118 // Clear uninitialized padding space. This ensures that the snapshot content
119 // is deterministic.
120 inline void clear_padding();
121
122 // Maximal memory consumption for a single BytecodeArray.
123 static const int kMaxSize = 512 * MB;
124 // Maximal length of a single BytecodeArray.
125 static const int kMaxLength = kMaxSize - kHeaderSize;
126
127#define FIELD_LIST(V) \
128 V(kLengthOffset, kTaggedSize) \
129 V(kWrapperOffset, kTaggedSize) \
130 V(kSourcePositionTableOffset, kTaggedSize) \
131 V(kHandlerTableOffset, kTaggedSize) \
132 V(kConstantPoolOffset, kTaggedSize) \
133 V(kFrameSizeOffset, kInt32Size) \
134 V(kParameterSizeOffset, kInt32Size) \
135 V(kIncomingNewTargetOrGeneratorRegisterOffset, kInt32Size) \
136 V(kOptionalPaddingOffset, 0) \
137 V(kUnalignedHeaderSize, OBJECT_POINTER_PADDING(kUnalignedHeaderSize)) \
138 V(kHeaderSize, 0) \
139 V(kBytesOffset, 0)
140
141 DEFINE_FIELD_OFFSET_CONSTANTS(ExposedTrustedObject::kHeaderSize, FIELD_LIST)
142#undef FIELD_LIST
143
144 class BodyDescriptor;
145
146 OBJECT_CONSTRUCTORS(BytecodeArray, ExposedTrustedObject);
147};
148
149// A BytecodeWrapper wraps a BytecodeArray but lives inside the sandbox. This
150// can be useful for example when a reference to a BytecodeArray needs to be
151// stored along other tagged pointers inside an array or similar datastructure.
152class BytecodeWrapper : public Struct {
153 public:
154 DECL_TRUSTED_POINTER_ACCESSORS(bytecode, BytecodeArray)
155
156 DECL_CAST(BytecodeWrapper)
157 DECL_PRINTER(BytecodeWrapper)
158 DECL_VERIFIER(BytecodeWrapper)
159
160 // When flushing bytecode, we in-place convert the wrapper object to an
161 // UncompiledData object (we cannot convert the BytecodeArray itself as that
162 // lives in trusted space). As such, the wrapper object must be at least as
163 // large as an UncompiledData object and therefore requires padding.
164#define FIELD_LIST(V) \
165 V(kBytecodeOffset, kTrustedPointerSize) \
166 V(kPadding1Offset, kInt32Size) \
167 V(kPadding2Offset, kInt32Size) \
168 V(kHeaderSize, 0) \
169 V(kSize, 0)
170
171 DEFINE_FIELD_OFFSET_CONSTANTS(Struct::kHeaderSize, FIELD_LIST)
172#undef FIELD_LIST
173
174 inline void clear_padding();
175
176 class BodyDescriptor;
177
178 OBJECT_CONSTRUCTORS(BytecodeWrapper, Struct);
179};
180
181} // namespace internal
182} // namespace v8
183
184#include "src/objects/object-macros-undef.h"
185
186#endif // V8_OBJECTS_BYTECODE_ARRAY_H_
